title: DefaultIcon​
content: </> Config.DefaultIcon: string This config is for changing the default player icon and it should represent a string which correlates to an image id.

title: SetIconRetrieveHandler​
content: </> UserPanel.SetIconRetrieveHandler( iconRetrieveHandler: (plr: Player ) → string-- This function passes the player as an arg then should return a image id ) → () This function sets the iconRetrieveHandler which is a function that gets called when a users icon is being generated for their user frame. note This handler can be set to override a players icon in LeaderboardExtended.

title: Init​
content: </> UserPanel.Init(leaderboardExtended: LeaderboardExtended) → () This function initializes the UserPanel passing the LeaderboardExtended reference.

title: new​
content: </> UserPanel.new( plr: Player , userIconID: string? ) → UserPanel This function creates a new UserPanel object and is mainly for internal use.

title: Destroy​
content: </> UserPanel:Destroy() → () This method destroys the UserPanel object destroying the UserFrame and clearing references.

title: UserPanel​
content: reference </> LeaderboardExtended.UserPanel: UserPanel This property stores a reference to the UserPanel class.

title: LoadConfig​
content: </> LeaderboardExtended.LoadConfig(config: Types.Config) → () This function loads the passed Config into LeaderboardExtended.

title: GetConfig​
content: </> LeaderboardExtended.GetConfig() → Types.Config This function returns the active loaded configuration being used by LeaderboardExtended.

title: GetUI​
content: </> LeaderboardExtended.GetUI() → LeaderboardUI This function is used to retrieve the LeaderboardExtended UI.

title: Init​
content: </> LeaderboardExtended.Init(config: Types.Config) → () This function must be called and it initializes LeaderboardExtended setting up the users UserPanel objects and draws the UI. danger Failure to call this function will cause LeaderboardExtended to break.
